bugs.title: CVE-2021-37220 mupdf: out-of-bounds write because the cached color converter does not properly consider the maximum key size of a hash table [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-37220 mupdf: out-of-bounds write because the cached color converter does not properly consider the maximum key size of a hash table [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-37220 mupdf: out-of-bounds write because the cached color converter does not properly consider the maximum key size of a hash table

long_desc.thetext:
MuPDF through 1.18.1 has an out-of-bounds write because the cached color converter does not properly consider the maximum key size of a hash table. This can, for example, be seen with crafted "mutool draw" input.

Reference:

https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=703791
http://git.ghostscript.com/?p=mupdf.git;h=f5712c9949d026e4b891b25837edd2edc166151f

Created mupdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1985254]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1985253,1985254

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
Will be fixed by the update to 1.19.0.

Based on the information from anitya: https://release-monitoring.org/project/2034/

Created attachment 1829800
[patch] Update to 1.19.0 (#2011302)
the-new-hotness/release-monitoring.org's scratch build of mupdf-1.19.0-1.fc34.src.rpm for rawhide failed http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=76799672

Builds work locally (including zathura-pdf-mupdf), but the push will be held up by:

- beta freeze
- python-PyMuPDF ftbfs with mupdf 1.19.0 (upstream is working on that)
- pending decision whether to enable OCR (leptonica/tesseract), given the poor results reported so far

Based on the information from anitya: https://release-monitoring.org/project/17320/

https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/mjg/python-PyMuPDF/ has a few builds against test builds of mupdf 1.19.0.

If these work well (in particular the new OCR features) I'll set up side-tags and coordinate mupdf, zathura-pdf-mupdf and python-PyMuPDF updates in Fedora. Let me know in case you need changes in the mupdf package (or if you know how to better solve the annoying lib versionning).

(In reply to Michael J Gruber from comment #1)
> https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/mjg/python-PyMuPDF/ has a few builds
> against test builds of mupdf 1.19.0.
> 
> If these work well (in particular the new OCR features) I'll set up
> side-tags and coordinate mupdf, zathura-pdf-mupdf and python-PyMuPDF updates
> in Fedora. Let me know in case you need changes in the mupdf package (or if
> you know how to better solve the annoying lib versionning).

Sounds good - looks like the PyMuPDF tests are passing so feel free to go for it.  Thanks!

OK, OCR needed a a patch, but the current build in copr works with upstream's OCR test, and my Fedora patch for PyMuPDF is upstreamed already :)

zathura-pdf-mupdf needed a patch, too.

I'll test the copr builds locally a little more and prepare the side tag then.

This enables OCR with the leptonica/tesseract engine.
